page.title: 13Tourism in Oxfordshire
page.content: The Farm Museum at Cogges, Witney gets visitors mostly from close to home and also from Ireland, France, Germany, Holland, Spain, Scandinavian countries Italy, Japan, U.S.A. and Canada. They get approximately 45,000 visitors a year although there were 70,000 in 1981 The Bishop's Palace was found recently at the Mount Mill site. They hope to be able make it into a tourist attraction because it is so old. It dates from Saxon times and Queen Emma. They are trying to uncover and restore the foundations but a great deal of funding must be found before any work can be started. Some old people's flats were to be built on the site when the remains were uncovered and they proved to be much more important than anyone had expected. If this is restored there will be even more tourists who will want to visit.
